role.title: Prepared By
role.desc: The organization that prepared this SAR.

role.title: Prepared For
role.desc: The organization for which this SAR was prepared. Typically the CSP.

role.title: Security Assessment Plan Approval
role.desc: The individual or individuals accountable for the accuracy of this SAR.

role.title: Assessment Team
role.desc: The individual or individuals performing the assessment.

role.title: Assessment Lead
role.desc: The individual leading the assessment activities.

role.title: Penetration Test Team
role.desc: The individual or individuals performing the penetration test.

role.title: Penetration Test Lead
role.desc: The individual leading the penetration test activities.

role.title: Assessment Organization's Managerial POC
role.desc: The management-level POC within the assessor's organization accountable for the organization's assessment performance.

role.title: CSP POCs During Testing
role.desc: At least three CSP testing points of contact must be identified in a FedRAMP SAP.

role.title: CSP Operations POC
role.desc: An operations center role, such as a SOC or NOC.

role.title: CSP's End of Testing Notification POC
role.desc: A role for an individual within the CSP to be notified by the assessor when testing is complete.

role.title: CSP Results POCs
role.desc: A role for the individuals within the CSP who are to receive the assessment results.

remarks.p: The assessor's HQ, or the address of the assessment team's primary business location.
Replace sample 3PAO information.
If the assessor is A2LA Certified, include the ISO/IEC-17020
Exactly one party
This is the assessor.
Exactly one party.
This is the UUID for the CSP in the SSP.
If no OSCAL-based SSP exists, create a CSP party in the SAP, and provide that UUID here.
One ore more parties
Exactly one party
Assessment Organization (3PAO)
One or more parties
Exactly one party
One or more partys
Exactly one party
Exactly one party
Exactly one party
The party-uuid should reference a party in the SSP.
If an appropriate party does not exist in the SSP, the SAP tool should add a party to the SAP, or have the CSP add the party to the SSP..
The SAP tool should not modify the SSP.
There should be at least three CSP Assessment POCs.
At least one should be available 24x7 during assessment activities.
At least one should be an operations center, such a SOC or NOC.
The party-uuid should reference a party in the SSP or SAP.
If an appropriate party does not exist in the SSP or SAP, the SAR tool should add a party to the SAR.
The SAP tool should not modify the SSP.
One or more parties
One or more parties
This OSCAL-based FedRAMP SAR Template can be used for the FedRAMP initial or annual assessment reporting.
FedRAMP prefers the path for the SAP be relative to the location of this SAR file. Absolute links will not work when FedRAMP tools import the content.
This may point to a back-matter resource using a URI fragment.

description.p: Include all controls in the SSP's baseline, except as explicitly excluded elsewhere.

remarks.p: OSCAL Extension

description.p: Includes all objectives for all in-scope controls as defined in the controls assembly.
A description of the included components.
A description of the included inventory-items.
A description of the included locations.
A description of the included users.
Exclude identified Windows laptop from scans.
A Windows laptop, which is not defined in the SSP inventory.

part.name: authorization-statement
part.p: Priority levels were established based on [describe].

part.name: authorization-statement
part.p: Notes and other information the assessor may wish to provide related to a continued authorization recommendation.

part.name: authorization-statement
part.p: [3PAO Name] attests that the SAR from the [system name] [initial | annual] assessment testing provides a complete assessment of the applicable FedRAMP controls as stipulated in the SAP. Evidence to validate the successful implementation of the various security controls has been collected and validated. Based on the remaining risks, and continuous improvements of security related processes and controls, [3PAO Name] recommends a continued authorization be granted for the [system name].

description.p: Description of the manual test

We will login as a customer and try to see if we can gain access to the Network Administrator and Database Administrator privileges and authorizations by navigating to different views and manually forcing the browser to various URLs
We will test the CAPTCHA function on the web form manually
We will manually test to see if OCSP is validating certificates.

task.title: Send Final Version of SAR to CSP and ISSO

description.p: optional description here
Port scans and other network service interaction and queries
Network sniffing, traffic monitoring, traffic analysis, and host discovery
Attempted logins or other use of systems, with any account name/password
Attempted structured query language (SQL) injection and other forms of input parameter testing
Use of exploit code for leveraging discovered vulnerabilities
Password cracking via capture and scanning of authentication databases
Spoofing or deceiving servers regarding network traffic
Altering running system configuration except where denial of service would result
Adding user accounts
Changes to assigned user passwords
Modification of user files or system files
Telephone modem probes and scans (active and passive)
Intentional viewing of [CSP Name] staff email, Internet caches, and/or personnel cookie files
Denial of service attacks
Exploits that will introduce new weaknesses to the system
Intentional introduction of malicious code (viruses, Trojans, worms, etc.)
Brief assessment description.
An overall statement about the system's satisfaction of this objective.
[EXAMPLE]The AC policy existed, and had all the required elements.

remarks.p: The subject-reference identifies a policy that was reviewed and is attached in the back-matter.
The observation source is linked to the task in the schedule associated with performing document reviews.
Even though the policy may be defined in the SSP and OSCAL would allow the SAR to reference it, FedRAMP requires the assessor attach all evidence to the SAR..

description.p: [EXAMPLE]The person interviewed knew about the policy and where to find it.
This describes the evidence, and adds relevant detail.
For example, this could cite where to find this information in interview notes.

remarks.p: The subject-reference is linked to the person interviewed.
The observation source is linked to the task in the schedule associated with performing staff interviews.
The relevant-evidence is linked to the interview notes.
These may be defined in the SSP, SAP, or SAR. Tools should check all three locations.

description.p: This is a description of the identified risk.
TCW: Identified Risk.
Scans: Vulnerability Description.
Pen Test: Risk Description.
RET: Description.

risk-statement.p: This is a statement about the identified risk.

description.p: A description of the recommended remediation.
TCW: Assessor's recommended remediation (type='recommendation').
Scans: Tool's recommended remediation (type='recommendation')
Pen Test: Assessor's recommended remediation (type='recommendation')
RET: Assessor's recommended remediation (type='recommendation').
POA&M: CSP's intended remediation (no type flag).
[EXAMPLE]There is an issue with .
[EXAMPLE]The SSP describes a procedure that does not exist in the official repository.
An attached screen shot showing the list of authoritative procedures in the repository.

remarks.p: If this was an issue where an inventory-item or component was not configured as described in the SSP, this observation could also include a subject-reference for each item that does not match the SSP.

description.p: This is a description of the identified risk.
TCW: Identified Risk.
Scans: Vulnerability Description.
Pen Test: Risk Description.
RET: Description.

risk-statement.p: This is a statement about the identified risk.

description.p: A description of the recommended remediation.
TCW: Assessor's recommended remediation (type='recommendation').
Scans: Tool's recommended remediation (type='recommendation')
Pen Test: Assessor's recommended remediation (type='recommendation')
RET: Assessor's recommended remediation (type='recommendation').
POA&M: CSP's intended remediation (no type flag).
The results of the discovery scan.
Undocumented devices found on network.
Raw scanner tool output - discovery scan.

remarks.p: Undocumented hosts are entered into the SAR's assessment-subjects, local-definitions section as inventory-items or components.
Undocumented hosts are listed in the observations assembly as subject-references.
The origin must contain the UUID of the tool used to perform the scan.
The UUID for the tool operator must be listed as the party-uuid for the finding. There may be more than one.

description.p: An example set of infrastructure scan findings.
[EXAMPLE]Scanner Output.
Raw scanner tool output - Infrastructure and OS Scan.
Provide the justification for the operational requirement.
A screen shot showing the system impact when patch is applied.
Vendor detail describing why this happens.
Describe the false positive here.
A screen shot showing the setting is correct
Vendor detail describing why this happens.
Describe the risk adjustment justification here.
This is a description of the vulnerability provided by the tool.

risk-statement.p: This is a statement about the identified risk as provided by the tool.
This field must be present, but may be blank (or state 'No Risk Statement' if no statement is provided by the tool.

description.p: Describe mitigating factor
Describe why the cited implementation statement justifies lowering the risk.
A description of the recommended remediation as provided by the tool.
A description of the recommended remediation as provided by the assessor.

remarks.p: The assessor may add their recommendation in addition to the tool's recommendation, or if no tool recommendation is provided.
The assessor should leave the tool recommendation, even if adding their own.

description.p: Describe what action(s) the CSP took to close the risk.

remarks.p: Recommended and planned remediation entries should remain. Simply add the "actual" remediation.
The remediation-origin should identify the UUID for the CSP as defined in the SSP.

description.p: The Results of the spear phishing test.
[EXAMPLE]Spear phishing test yielded a 22% click rate.
[EXAMPLE]The target threshold was below 20%.
Spear Phishing Report.

remarks.p: When reporting a result for a test such as the spear phishing activity, a risk assembly is required if the result is to be reported in the Risk Exposure Table.

description.p: A finding from penetration testing activities.
[EXAMPLE]Describe the finding.
Penetration Test Report.
This is a description of the issue found by the penetration testing team.

risk-statement.p: This is a statement about the identified risk identified by penetraton testing.

description.p: A description of the recommended remediation as provided by the assessor.

remarks.p: The assessor may add their recommendation.
If a penetration test result is positive, such as to say the SOC detected the activities appropriately, no risk is required.
If a penetration test result identifies a vulnerability or deficiency, the risk assembly is required.

description.p: [EXAMPLE]This is the contents of the Observations and Evidence cell in the TCW.

remarks.p: A tool could use either an rlink or base64 field.
If both are present, FedRAMP tools will give preference to the base64 content.
There may be more than one rlink.
If there is no base64 field, at lest one of the rlink fields must include a relative path.

If both are present, FedRAMP tools will give preference to the base64 content.
There may be more than one rlink.
If there is no base64 field, at lest one of the rlink fields must include a relative path.

FedRAMP is formulating guidelines for handling digital/electronic signatures in OSCAL, and welcome feedback on solutions.
For now, FedRAMP recommends one of the following:

ul.li: Render the OSCAL SAR content as a PDF that is digitally signed and attached.
Render the OSCAL SAR content as printed pages that are physically signed, scanned, and attached.

remarks.p: If your organization prefers another approach, please seek prior approval from the FedRAMP PMO.
